mentions.context: The synthetic soundscapes are generated using Scaper [9].
Unless mentioned otherwise, the Sox based reverb in Scaper is deactivated in all the subsets.

A reference subset comprised of 828 soundscapes is generated with Scaper scripts that are designed such that the distribution of sound events per class, the number of sound events per clip (depending on the class) and the sound event class co-occurrence are similar to that of the validation set which is composed of real recordings.

A reference subset comprised of 828 soundscapes is generated with Scaper scripts that are designed such that the distribution of sound events per class, the number of sound events per clip (depending on the class) and the sound event class co-occurrence are similar to that of the validation set which is composed of real recordings.
F-scores are computed on a single operating point (fixed decision thresholds) using the sed eval library [11].

During DCASE 2019 task 4, capitalizing on the possibility to have a full control on the properties of the soundscapes generated with Scaper [9], we benchmarked SED submissions on soundscapes designed to investigate several SED challenges such as foreground event to background ratio or time localization of the sound event within a clip challenges [10].
